medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain described as band-like across mid abdomen, right greater than left, with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms developed after the patient was discharged home following an ERCP procedure. The abdominal pain was persistent and did not improve with Tylenol or Vicodin, prompting the patient to come into the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Back pain, left knee meniscus surgery, sebaceous cyst removal from back, childhood car accident with possible spleen injury.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died at young age from pneumonia; father with coronary artery disease.
